result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric J. SCHWARZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • PTC Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to the sentence presently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with Dylan Burton.

No contact with any known illicit drug dealers or users.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant in custody.  
The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of PTC Deliver Heroin and PTC Deliver Heroin within 1,000 feet of park.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 12-22-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Dylan Burton and defendant must not travel outside Manitowoc County.
